clinical_study.brief_title: Management of Drooling in Children With Cerebral Palsy in France
clinical_study.official_title: Management of Drooling in Children With Cerebral Palsy: A French Survey of the Practices and Opinions of Health Professionals

brief_summary.textblock: The study is a transversal, observational, descriptive survey of the practices and opinions of health professionals carried out nationally across France that aims to characterize children with cerebral palsy and pathological drooling and to describe care pathways, assessment and treatment of drooling.

primary_outcome.measure: Questionnaire on the assessment and treatment of drooling in children with Cerebral Palsy
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (At the time of the questionnaire mailing to the professionals)
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire will measure practices of health professionals involved in care pathways, assessment and treatment of drooling in children with Cerebral Palsy.

arm_group.description: health care professionals potentially involved in assessment and/or treatment of drooling in children with Cerebral Palsy.

intervention.description: Survey of the practices and opinions of health care professionals to describe care pathways, assessment and treatment of drooling in children with cerebral palsy

study_pop.textblock: health care professionals potentially involved in assessment and/or treatment of drooling in children with Cerebral Palsy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- health professional known to assess and/or treat drooling
- health professional known to assess and/or treat children with Cerebral Palsy
- health professional exercising in France
Exclusion Criteria:
- health professional with an inactive e-mail address
